name: Volta Labs, Inc.
headline: Unlocking the utility of genomics for the world.
description:
Volta Labs is a genomics applications company that has developed a cutting-edge digital fluidics platform to maximize performance and scalability of sample preparation in genomics while providing unparalleled consistency. Volta is transforming the way biological research and analyses are performed, allowing scientists to focus on what they do best -- pushing the boundaries of biology.

As a collective of scientists and builders working at the intersection of engineering and biology, we imagine a world where extracting vital information from biological samples is as simple as pressing a button. That's our vision, and we're turning it into reality.

Our HQ is in Boston’s Seaport, where we develop and manufacture our technology. We believe in cross-functional collaboration and continuous learning –  whether your interest is in biology, MechEng, CompEng, or simply joining a fast-growing startup striving to make the world a better place, we'd love to welcome you to our team. Check out some of our blog posts to learn more about work life at Volta.

founders.name: Udayan Umapathi, Founder
founders.description:
As the founder and CEO of Volta Labs, Inc., I have over five years of experience in creating and scaling a company that is transforming the field of sequencing sample prep. With a background in entrepreneurship, engineering, design and biology, I have a unique perspective and skill set that enables me to bridge the gap between different disciplines and domains.

At Volta Labs, we are building a disruptive product that streamlines the entire process of preparing samples for any sequencing technol

generated_description:
**Volta Labs, Inc.**

**Mission:** Unlocking the utility of genomics for the world.

Founded in 2018 and hailing from Boston’s vibrant Seaport neighborhood, Volta Labs is at the forefront of genomics technology. This cutting-edge application company has developed an innovative digital fluidics platform that optimizes sample preparation in genomics—making it more efficient and consistent. Essentially, they are transforming how biological research and analysis are conducted, enabling scientists to focus on pushing the boundaries of biology rather than getting bogged down in the minutiae of sample prep.

Volta's vision is compelling: they imagine a world where extracting crucial information from biological samples could be as simple as pressing a button. They have a strong team of about 50 employees, a unique blend of scientists and engineers, dedicated to merging biology with advanced technology to engineer the future of genomics. 

Their flagship product, the Callisto system, exemplifies this vision by providing push-button sample preparations for various sequencers—just think of it as taking the hassle out of complicated processes. They're also tagged within the hard-tech domain, covering hardware, robotics, and biotechnology, which points to their interdisciplinary approach.

Located in Cambridge, MA, with roots in the renowned Y Combinator Batch W19, Volta Labs emphasizes cross-functional collaboration and ongoing learning. They're not just building a product; they're building a community focused on innovation in bioscience. They actively engage with their audience through blogs and resources, ensuring transparency about their journey and work culture.

If you're interested in joining a rapidly growing startup striving to better the world through genomics, they're open to welcoming passionate individuals from diverse backgrounds. Explore their [website](http://voltalabs.com) to learn more about their work, products, and career opportunities.
